name: U.S.S. Maine National Monument
Location: 59th Street and Central Park West, Columbus Circle
descrip: Pylon fountain embellished with colossal group, nine figures (heroic scale), and frieze; three plaques (two large, one small); four gate houses, each with a door and three low reliefs
dimen: Total H: 63' L: 74' W: 55'; Pylon face W: 17'9" at bottom, 15' at top; side, W: 15'6" at bottom, 13' at top; Base L 21'6" W: 19'; Colossal group H: 20'; Large plaques H: 1'1" W: 1'3"; Small plaque H: 6" W: 10"; Each gate house H: 12'6" L: 9' W: 9'
materials: Pylon--Maine granite; colossal group--bronze (gilded); figures--Tennessee pink marble; plaques--bronze; gate houses--marble; gate house doors--bronze; gate house reliefs--granite
foundry: Jno. Williams Inc., Bronze Foundry, NY ("In Memoriam" plaque)
sculptor: Attilio Piccirilli (colossal group and figures); Charles Keck ("In Memoriam" plaque)
donor: National Maine Monument Fund (raised by public subscription); United Spanish War Veterans (Chidwick plaque only)
Categories: Spanish-American War, War Memorial, Animal: equestrian
